page.title: 03LIFESTYLES VILLAGE PUB
page.content: The New Inn is an early Victorian building.As late as 1943 it was only an ale house attached to the village shop and bakery but it now has a spirit licence and also provides the cooked meals expected by today's customers.A microwave oven is used for heating the food quickly but not for the initial cooking.Other facilities include a large car park and chairs under umbrellas in the garden,a bar billiard table,a dart board,two electronic games and a cigarette machine. At lunch time on Tuesday 16th July there was only one couple(retired)from Winterbourne itself.The older people who used to come in every night expecting their own seats and tankards have been driven out by the changed atmosphere.Most customers now come by car from neighbouring towns.
